N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 448.4 - Enforcement; exceptions

State Regulations
(a) The department may grant an exception to
compliance with one or more provisions of section
448.3
of this Part upon finding
that compliance will result in undue hardship on a group home. The authorized
agency applying for the exception must demonstrate that, aside from the
exception, the group home is in substantial compliance with the provisions of
section
448.3
of this Part and that
granting the exception will not create any hazardous conditions which could
impair the health or safety of the children. The group home must comply with
any alternative requirements the department may consider necessary for the
protection of the health or safety of the children. All exceptions must be
requested by the authorized agency in writing and approved by the department in
writing. (b) The provisions of this

Part that become effective September 1, 1994 shall apply to those group homes
established on or after such date. If compliance with any of the provisions of
this Part that become effective September 1, 1994 creates an undue hardship for
any group home in operation prior to such date, the group home must, within one
year of such date, submit to the department a schedule indicating when the
group home will achieve compliance with such provision. The compliance schedule
is subject to approval by the department and compliance with all provisions
that become effective September 1, 1994 must be achieved within five years of
such date. Notes
